titles: The love-sick serving-man: shewing how he was wounded with the charms of a young lady, but did not dare to reveal his mind. To the tune of He often for my Jenny strove.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare. J. Back.,
notes: Date and place of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "E'er since I saw Clorinda's eyes ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
